node.title: Victims at Christmas Parade Were Young Musicians and Dancing Grannies
node.description: Five adults died in Waukesha, Wis., and at least 10 children were in intensive care. Three were members of a Milwaukee dance troupe, which celebrated grandmothers.
node.content: ["WAUKESHA, Wis. \u2014 They were grandmothers and grandchildren, high school band members and husbands, strutting down Main Street in a celebration that had kicked off the local holiday season for more than a half-century.", "After a year of trauma and strife, the members of the Christmas parade in Waukesha, Wis., seemed to be marching for normalcy itself on Sunday when a maroon S.U.V. roared down upon them, turning the crowd\u2019s cheers into horrified screams.", "At least five people were confirmed dead on Monday, with at least 48 people injured, as authorities investigated the tragedy that erupted after they said a man fleeing from a knife fight rammed into the parade route. At least 18 of those hospitalized were children, including 10 in intensive care.", "Three of those killed were members of the Milwaukee Dancing Grannies, a group of women whose pompom routines have been a staple of local holiday parades since the 1980s: their choreographer, Virginia Sorenson, 79; LeAnna Owen, 71, a dancer; and Tamara Durand, 52, a new member performing for the first time. A fourth was a dancer\u2019s husband, Wilhelm Hospel, 81, and the fifth, Jane Kulich, 52, a Citizens Bank teller, had been marching just behind the group with her company float.", "\u201cShe was vibrant, energetic,\u201d David Durand, 52, said of his wife, Tamara, the group\u2019s youngest member.", "\u201cShe was that kind of person that captured your attention as soon as she walked into the room,\u201d he said. \u201cShe literally danced her way through the day.\u201d", "In a Facebook post, the group said it was \u201cdevastated.\u201d", "\u201cThose who died were extremely passionate Grannies,\u201d the statement said. \u201cOur group was doing what they loved, performing in front of crowds in a parade putting smiles on faces of all ages, filling them with joy and happiness.\u201d", "Videos of the parade street showed nine members of the troupe, in their signature blue winter jackets with white fur hats and white pompoms, dancing by to \u201cJingle Bell Rock.\u201d", "Greg Bentz, 52, a childhood friend of Ms. Kulich, said the bank employee had been handing out candy along the parade route when the S.U.V. struck her. \u201cShe had a ton of friends,\u201d he said, describing Ms. Kulich as \u201cchippy, cheery and outgoing.\u201d", "\u201cShe was an angel,\u201d said her niece, Desiree Kulich, 42. \u201cShe was always giving back to the community. She was a churchgoing \u2014 just a really good \u2014 person.\u201d Ms. Kulich\u2019s death had devastated her husband and three children, the niece added.", "At a news conference on Monday, the chief medical officer of the Children\u2019s Hospital of Wisconsin, Dr. Michael Gutzeit, said 18 children had been brought to the hospital after the parade, all between the ages of 3 and 16. The medical director of the hospital\u2019s intensive care unit, Dr. Michael Meyer, said 10 of them were in the I.C.U. and six were in critical condition.", "\u201cThe injuries from Sunday night will go well beyond the physical and will take time to heal,\u201d Dr. Gutzeit said.", "The victims include three sets of siblings, said Dr. Amy Drendel, the medical director for the hospital\u2019s emergency defense and trauma center. Their ailments range from facial abrasions to broken bones to serious head injuries.", "Another hospital, Aurora Medical Center-Summit, said in a statement that it was treating 13 patients, including three in critical condition. Officials at Froedtert Hospital said it had received seven patients.", "The School District of Waukesha canceled classes for several days because of the tragedy. Officials with the Xtreme Dance team, another group that marched, asked for thoughts, prayers and \u201cprivacy to process the tragic events.\u201d GoFundMe accounts posted in behalf of families of the dance troupe\u2019s members said that at least one child, the daughter of a single mother with five children, had lost a kidney and suffered a broken pelvis and lacerated liver. A photo that organizers said had been taken shortly before the crash showed the girls performing in black outfits with silver and white knit caps and white pompoms.", "The Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Milwaukee said a priest was among the injured, along with parishioners and students at a local Catholic school.", "As a frigid dusk fell on Monday, hundreds gathered at a nearby park to mourn the victims. \u201cTonight is the first night to healing our community and we take a small step to lift up those in need,\u201d Mayor Shawn Reilly told the gathering. \u201cTonight I ask for your prayers.\u201d", "The tragedy upended what participants and onlookers described as a joyous night in Waukesha, a bedroom community about 20 miles west of Milwaukee. Last year\u2019s parade had been canceled because of the coronavirus pandemic, and this year\u2019s had come on the heels of the acquittal of Kyle Rittenhouse an hour away in Kenosha, in a politically charged case that had left Wisconsin and the nation divided and raw. More than 60 entries, from the Fire Department to the Waukesha Old Car Club to Santa Claus, were scheduled to march through downtown.", "Witnesses described chaos in the moments after a driver plowed through the barricades and into the parade; the authorities later arrested a suspect they identified as Darrell E. Brooks Jr., 39. Mikey Randa, 14, said he was marching with his high school football team when he saw a young girl hit by the car.", "\u201cThe car just flew past us, there was a lot of panic,\u201d he said, adding that he initially did not grasp what had happened. Mr. Randa said he then saw five or six bodies lying on the ground.", "\u201cI\u2019m still in a bit of a shock,\u201d he said.", "Jason Kellner, 49, said he had just watched his son, a drum player in the Waukesha South High School marching band, pass by when he saw the S.U.V. heading toward the crowd. After passing through an intersection, Mr. Kellner said, the car \u201cstarted mowing people down.\u201d", "He said that as he ran to find his son, he saw several apparent victims on the ground and a bloody saxophone. But he found his son unharmed by the side of the road.", "\u201cI\u2019ve never felt a worse feeling,\u201d Mr. Kellner said, \u201cwondering what I\u2019m going to find when I get to my kid.\u201d"]
